title: Structured Training Program for AI-Driven Educational Tool Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and specialized expertise in social sciences
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices via BYOD (Bring Your Own Device), aiming to integrate AI tools immediately applicable in real work environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain and apply ethical principles for using LLM tools like ChatGPT in educational settings

Learners apply the ADDIE model (Analysis-Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation) to design one customized educational scenario for a specific learner group (e.g., adult literacy learners) using AI tools like ChatGPT and MidJourney, pilot it for four weeks, and submit an effectiveness report (80%+ participation, 20%+ learning outcome improvement).

Through project-based assessment (4 weeks), learners select one real-world public/nonprofit task (e.g., community service optimization, resource allocation efficiency), design a solution using AI tools (chatbots, data analysis), and submit a deliverable (report or prototype). They achieve ≥4/5 points in four of five rubric items (problem definition, AI applicability, feasibility, creativity, completeness).

Learners identify three specific privacy issues arising from AI tools (ChatGPT, facial recognition systems) and write a 1,500-character report proposing ≥2 solutions (e.g., encryption, access hierarchy, data minimization) per issue. The report must earn "excellent" in ≥4 of 5 rubric items (clarity, validity, practicality, creativity, format).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
